name: emptily
content:
emptily adverb
(CONTAINING NOTHING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that does not contain any things or people: His hands hung emptily at his sides, and he could think of nothing to say. The scaffolding of the half-built mill stood emptily, like the skeleton of a forest. See
empty
More examplesFewer examplesWe were stopped for speeding on one of those roads that open emptily and irresistibly before you go all the way to the horizon.Voices ring emptily against the brick walls.

emptily adverb
(NOT SINCERE)
in a way that is not sincere or is without any real meaning: She uses emptily flattering phrases. The claim to moral superiority rings more emptily than ever.
More examplesFewer examplesHis words ring emptily.The company emptily promised to look for partnerships with local groups.
